intro: Eschweilera timbuchensis, commonly known as the Timbuche palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest of South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in inflorescences, which are typically pollinated by insects. Eschweilera timbuchensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
